content.new:
Even though there is no official release of both, it might be worthy to take into consideration that there a dependencies missing. Trying to install Gazebo 11 in Ubuntu 20.04 in a Docker container with base in `ubuntu:20.04` results in the following error:

```shell
The following packages have unmet dependencies:
 gazebo11 : Depends: libboost-regex1.71.0-icu65 but it is not installable
            Depends: libgazebo11 (= 11.0.0-1~focal) but it is not going to be installed
 libgazebo11-dev : Depends: libgazebo11 (= 11.0.0-1~focal) but it is not going to be installed
                   Depends: gazebo11-plugin-base (= 11.0.0-1~focal) but it is not going to be installed
```

`libboost-regex1.71.0-icu66` is already available in Focal. Now I am not sure if this is a problem of the base container not being updated, or if this is a real dependency issue \(I don’t have 20.04 natively installed or in a VM to try it\).

Any pointers? Thank you

issue.title: Unable to install Gazebo 11 in Ubuntu 20.04 because of missing dependency in 'libboost-regex1.71.0-icu65'
Unable to install Gazebo 11 in Ubuntu 20.04 because of missing dependency in 'libboost-regex1.71.0-icu65'

message.raw:
I can confirm the problem. Looks to me like at some point of the focal preparation Ubuntu rebuilt part of the boost libraries and in one of these temporary steps the dependency ended up in our packages. Note that we are not listed any particular version of Ubuntu boost regexp in our [building metadata](https://github.com/ignition-release/gazebo11-release/blob/master/focal/debian/control).

I rebuilding a new version of gazebo11 to check if the problem still persists.
message.html:
I can confirm the problem. Looks to me like at some point of the focal preparation Ubuntu rebuilt part of the boost libraries and in one of these temporary steps the dependency ended up in our packages. Note that we are not listed any particular version of Ubuntu boost regexp in our building metadata.

I rebuilding a new version of gazebo11 to check if the problem still persists.

issue.title: Unable to install Gazebo 11 in Ubuntu 20.04 because of missing dependency in 'libboost-regex1.71.0-icu65'

message.raw: 11.0.0-2 is in the repositories now. Seems to work in a quick test https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/_test_gazebo-install-gazebo11_pkg-focal-amd64/8/console
message.html: 11.0.0-2 is in the repositories now. Seems to work in a quick test https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/_test_gazebo-install-gazebo11_pkg-focal-amd64/8/console
